title: The best new words added to the Oxford English Dictionary in 2015
body:
In just the last three months of 2015 over 500 English words and phrases were added to the Oxford English Dictionary. Get with the times and develop your English vocabulary: here is our pick of the best new words in 2015.

[Phablet](https://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/phablet)– A smartphone with a screen which is intermediate in size between that of a typical smartphone and a tablet computer.

[Chiffonade](https://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/chiffonade) – A preparation of shredded or finely cut leaf vegetables, used as a garnish for soup.

[Flotus](https://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/flotus) – an acronym for the First Lady of the United States.

[Internaut](https://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/internaut) – A user of the Internet, especially a habitual or skilled one.

[Pasalubong](https://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/pasalubong) – A gift or souvenir given to a friend or relative by a person who has returned from a trip or arrived for a visit.

[Roastery](https://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/roastery) – A place where coffee beans are roasted or processed.

[Sinigang](https://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/sinigang) – In Filipino cookery: a type of soup made with meat, shrimp, or fish and flavoured with a sour ingredient such as tamarind or guava.

[Tenderpreneur](http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/tenderpreneur) – A person who uses his or her political connections to secure government contracts and tenders for personal advantage.

[Zef](http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/zef) – Common; ‘trashy’.
